txt.en: 'If you wish, go with him, and save your lives.'
'But I will fight! I will not abandon the Fords!'
'I will avenge Théodred and hold shut the realm against our enemy until I can stand no longer!'
'Who will stand and fight with me?!'
'Erkenbrand has been cut off by the host upon the shore!'
'What -- what is this?'
'Our men begin to dwindle, and the enemy grows in strength.'
'Will no one fight with me?'
'Elfhelm, please....'
'How did Isengard raise such a fearsome horde?'
'This is where I belong.'
'Come, Elfhelm -- let us draw our swords together once more.'
'I have cheated death for too long. Just leave me alone.'
'We will not live to see the morrow, but our foes will be the weaker for it!'
Elfhelm
'I am here to defend the Fords until my last breath, Elfhelm.'
'Warriors of Rohan, hear me!'
'Erkenbrand cannot reach us, and our force is severed.'
'Elfhelm believes we should retreat while we still can.'
'I have wronged your husband, lady Hildith, but I hope this rights things between myself and Grimbold.'
'It would seem we have all abandoned him....'
'The last host of Eorlingas rides forth, and it shall not return without battle.'
Hildith
Théoden
'I find myself reflecting upon my regrets.'
'You thought I remained in Meduseld, hunched like an old tree beneath winter snow.'
Dunward
'So it was when you went to war. But a wind from the west has shaken the boughs....'
'You are leading as Grimbold would, brave and just.'
'Can it be true? The king has ridden to war himself?'
'It may be so, Dunward, but I cannot take back my last words to my husband.'
'The king leaves his hall and rides to war?'
'If he lives, he is abandoned and alone. It is my fault.'
'I feel as if I slumbered too long, and woke to find the world wholly changed....'
'My Hildith....'
'I could not save his son, but I will endeavour to keep my king from harm.'
'No, it will not do. Rohan will fall, and I will fall with it.'
'For Théoden! For Erkenbrand!'
'There is grave danger ahead....'
